com.incadencecorp.coalesce.common.helpers

Class FileHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.incadencecorp.coalesce.common.helpers.FileHelper

  • public final class FileHelper
extends Object
    Provides helper methods for accessing and interacting with files.
    Author:
    InCadence

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getExtension

        public static String getExtension(String filename)
        Returns the extension for the filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename
        Returns:
        the extension for the filename
        See Also:
        FilenameUtils.getExtension(String filename)

      • getShortFilename

        public static String getShortFilename(String filename)
        Gets the name minus the path from a full filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename
        Returns:
        the name of the file without the path, or an empty string if none exists
        See Also:
        FilenameUtils.getName(String filename)

      • getFileAsByteArray

        public static byte[] getFileAsByteArray(String filename)
                                 throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getFileAsByteArray

        public static byte[] getFileAsByteArray(String filename,
                                        boolean encrypted)
                                 throws IOException
        Returns all the bytes for the file. If the file is encrypted then it is first decrypted using the pass phrase returned by CoalesceSettings.getPassPhrase()
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename
        encrypted - whether the file needs to be decrypted first
        Returns:
        the bytes from the file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • deleteFile

        public static boolean deleteFile(String filename)
        Deletes the file if it exists. If the filename is a directory then the deletion will fail.
        Parameters:
        filename - the full path and name of the file to be deleted.
        Returns:
        true if the file is successfully deleted.

      • deleteFolder

        public static boolean deleteFolder(String folderPath)
        Deletes the folder if it exists. If the folder path does not point to a folder then it will not be deleted. Folders will be delete even if they are not empty.
        Parameters:
        folderPath - the full folder path
        Returns:
        true if the folder is successfully deleted.

      • deleteFolder

        public static boolean deleteFolder(String folderPath,
                                   boolean forceDelete)
        Deletes the folder if it exists. If the folder path does not point to a folder then it will not be deleted. Folders that are not empty will only be deleted if forceDelete is true.
        Parameters:
        folderPath - the full folder path
        Returns:
        true if the folder is successfully deleted.

      • checkFolder

        public static boolean checkFolder(String folderPath)
        Checks if the folder already exists in the file system and if it does not then attempts to create it including all missing parent directories.
        Parameters:
        folderPath - the full folder path
        Returns:
        true if the folder already exists or was successfully created. false if the folderPath points to a non-folder or creation of the folder fails.

      • getBaseFilenameWithFullDirectoryPathForKey

        public static String getBaseFilenameWithFullDirectoryPathForKey(String key)
        Returns the base filename including the full path generated for the provided key. This method using the values from both CoalesceSettings.getBinaryFileStoreBasePath() and CoalesceSettings.getSubDirectoryLength() to build the path.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use for generating the path.
        Returns:
        the base filename including the full path.

      • getFullPath

        public static URI getFullPath(String value)
                       throws URISyntaxException
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        If the value provided is relative it will return a URI with an absolute path from System.getProperty("user.dir").
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException
